title: Implementation of the CHIPS Act of 2022

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to effectively implement the CHIPS Act of 2022, which aims to boost semiconductor research, development, and manufacturing in the United States. It establishes a steering council to coordinate efforts, prioritizes protecting taxpayer funds, strengthening domestic manufacturing, fostering innovation, and creating high-skilled jobs, especially in disadvantaged communities.
potential_concerns: The prioritization of semiconductor manufacturing investments may unevenly benefit urban or cluster locations, potentially limiting economic development opportunities for rural and tribal communities despite stated intentions.
Efforts to create well-paying, high-skilled union jobs could face pushback or exclusionary practices affecting non-union manufacturing workers and small businesses, limiting workforce inclusivity.

Accelerated domestic production might lead to increased demand for specialized labor, possibly disadvantaging workers without access to sufficient training or education, especially among racial and ethnic minorities.

Coordination across multiple federal agencies and levels of government may slow implementation and reduce responsiveness to local needs, undermining the goal of catalyzing regional economic development.

Focusing on reducing dependency on foreign supply chains could increase production costs domestically, potentially impacting small-business owners in the semiconductor supply chain who may struggle with higher operational expenses.
